Kettlewright.background_description: You are known by the smell of molten metal and the jingle of tin. You are no mere merchant but an artisan of fire and metal.

options.description: You build small contraptions for local guilds (and don't ask too many questions). Take an extra 40gp and a wanted poster with your face on it. Given time and materials, you can open almost any door or vault.
You deal in home goods and tools, hawking your wares to townspeople across the lands. Take 20gp worth of items from the gear table. You are fluent in the Traveler's Cant.
You were a military smelter, before peace destroyed your livelihood. Take a smelting hammer (d10, bulky) and a tin helm (+1 Armor). Given time and adequate materials, you can repair armor.

items.name: Smelting Hammer
items.description: Given time and adequate materials, you can repair armor.

options.description: You sell rare and quality items to monasteries and nobles alike. Take a Spyglass, a Necklace (petty) worth 20gp, and a Scroll of Mirrorwalk (petty).

items.name: Scroll (Mirrorwalk)
items.description: A mirror becomes a gateway to another mirror that you looked into today.

options.description: You offer protection as a service, quietly watching for threats as money exchanges hands. You start with +d4 HP, and carry a Long Sword (d10, bulky) and a Gambeson (+1 Armor).
You scavenge raw tin and iron from battlefields, pulling teeth from still-twitching corpses. Start with a young Donkey (+4 slots, slow), a Crossbow (d8 damage, bulky), and a Saw (d6).

table2.question: What never fails to get you out of trouble?

options.description: Fire Eggs: Six small pellets made of sea salt, wood, and crockery-dust. They explode at low heat (d8, blast) but the flames dissipate quickly.

items.name: Fire Eggs

options.description: Black Tar: Versatile: both sticky and highly flammable. 3 uses.

items.description: Versatile: both sticky and highly flammable.

options.description: Spiked Boots: Cracks heads (d8) as easily as it does ice and muck. Travel is also a bit slower, but easier.

options.description: Tinker's Paste: Seals shut any fist-sized opening. 3 uses.
Fireworks: A dazzling albeit dangerous display. Enough explosive material to blow off a finger or three. 2 uses remain.

options.description: A clever pet, small enough to hide in your pack (bulky), but strong enough to scare off smaller predators. Requires one Ration a day, and it must be meat.
